question: If the angle of minimum deviation is equal to angle of a prism for an equilateral prism, then the speed of light inside the prism is
explanation: Given prism is equilateral, so <katex>$A = 60^{\circ}$</katex>. Minimum deviation <katex>$\delta_m = A = 60^{\circ}$</katex>.
Speed of light in prism <katex>$v = \frac{c}{\mu} = \frac{3 \times 10^8}{\sqrt{3}} = \sqrt{3} \times 10^8 \text{ ms}^{-1}$</katex>.
